product_summary: CEBRA is a machine-learning method that can be used to compress time series data in a way that reveals otherwise hidden structures in the variability of the data. It excels on behavioral and neural data recorded simultaneously and can decode activity from the visual cortex of the mouse brain to reconstruct a viewed video.
product_pros: Can reveal hidden structures in behavioral and neural data
Can decode neural activity to reconstruct visual stimuli
Can be used to map space and uncover complex kinematic features
Produces consistent latent spaces across different data types and modalities
Can be used for hypothesis testing or label-free exploration
product_cons: May require significant computational resources for large datasets
Can be sensitive to the choice of hyperparameters
May not be suitable for all types of behavioral and neural data
Can be challenging to interpret the learned latent spaces
May not be able to capture all of the relevant information in the data

product_usecases.case: Decoding neural activity to reconstruct visual stimuli
product_usecases.details: CEBRA can be used to decode activity from the visual cortex of the mouse brain to reconstruct a viewed video. This can be used to study how the brain represents visual information.

product_usecases.case: Mapping space and uncovering complex kinematic features
product_usecases.details: CEBRA can be used to map space and uncover complex kinematic features in behavioral data. This can be used to study how animals navigate their environment and control their movements.

product_usecases.case: Producing consistent latent spaces across different data types and modalities
product_usecases.details: CEBRA can produce consistent latent spaces across different data types and modalities, such as calcium imaging and electrophysiology. This can be used to study how different types of neural activity relate to behavior.
CEBRA can be used for hypothesis testing by comparing the latent spaces learned from different groups of data. This can be used to test hypotheses about how behavior and neural activity are related.

CEBRA can be used for label-free exploration of behavioral and neural data. This can be used to uncover hidden patterns and structures in the data that may not be apparent from traditional analysis methods.

product_toolfor.details: CEBRA is a powerful tool for neuroscientists who are interested in studying the relationship between behavior and neural activity.
CEBRA is a novel machine learning method that can be used to develop new algorithms for analyzing behavioral and neural data.
CEBRA can be used by data scientists to analyze large datasets of behavioral and neural data.
CEBRA can be used by behavior analysts to study the behavior of animals and humans.
CEBRA is a valuable tool for students who are interested in learning about machine learning and data analysis.

product_pricing: CEBRA is open-source and freely available for use.
